definition: to be fascinated/to be captivated
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused

sentences.english: This was my first picture-book, and I was entranced by it.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一本图画书，它让我深深着迷。

sentences.english: MR. LU’S fascination with war came from eight years of service in the Chinese Army.
sentences.chinese: 陆川对于战争的着迷缘于他当了八年兵。

sentences.english: Men of this sort, “abusers of power”, both fascinated and repelled her.
sentences.chinese: 她对这类“滥权者”，既着迷又憎恶。

sentences.english: Love and it is not mysterious, WWw. 55dou. com it can always fascinated people.
sentences.chinese: 爱情它其实并不神秘，可总是让人对它很着迷。

sentences.english: The prospect of billion-year storage is fascinating and a little terrifying.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存数十亿年的愿景令人着迷却又有点可怕。

sentences.english: Fascinated, my eyes reverting from the south, dropt, to follow those.
sentences.chinese: 令人着迷，目转南方答之不及，低，那些落叶。

sentences.english: Computer really hypnotizes everybody,there are more and more netters now.
sentences.chinese: 计算机确实令每一个人着迷，现在的网民越来越多了。

sentences.english: I was very fascinated with meteorology at a young age.
sentences.chinese: 小时候我曾对气象学非常着迷。

sentences.english: I really dont know why you are so obsessed with all my secrets.
sentences.chinese: 我真的不明白为什么你着迷于我的所有秘密。

sentences.english: The story of the " unsinkable " luxury liner Titanic has fascinated people for nearly a century.
sentences.chinese: 人们对永不沉没的泰坦尼克号豪华轮着迷近一个世纪。

sentences.english: The performance of Amber is really fascinating.
sentences.chinese: 郭采洁的表演真是令人着迷啊。

sentences.english: I acknowledge that Stella is very charming, but that doesn't mean I am fascinated by her.
sentences.chinese: 我承认史黛拉很迷人，但那并不表示我已对她着迷。

sentences.english: I've been taking pictures since I was 12, and I've always been fascinated by biology.
sentences.chinese: 我12岁就开始拍照片，而且我一直对生物学着迷。

sentences.english: That was Gordo, obsessing about his hacky-sack.
sentences.chinese: 那是戈多，正着迷于他的沙包。

sentences.english: The fixation on seeding the world with mini-leakers springs from a sense of inborn superiority, according our source.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的信息来源，对播种着迷的人有先天优越感。

sentences.english: The printed word always fascinated horace .
sentences.chinese: 书上的铅字总使小霍勒斯着迷。

infatuated/obsessed
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue

one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
to be fascinated/to be rapt/to long for/to dream of
bewitched/intoxicated by sth
enchanted/fascinated/charmed
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
ecstatic/enraptured
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
